concise_definition: v. 打破, 扰乱, 中断

definitions.explanation_en: To cause a major interruption or disturbance in the normal course, function, or operation of something, often leading to instability or breakdown.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对某事物的正常进程、功能或运作造成重大中断或干扰，通常导致不稳定或瘫痪。
definitions.example_en: The storm was disrupting power supplies across the entire region.
definitions.example_cn: 这场风暴正在扰乱整个地区的电力供应。

definitions.explanation_en: To fundamentally change or overthrow an existing system, market, or process by introducing something new and more effective, often in a technological or business context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过引入更新、更有效的事物，从根本上改变或颠覆现有的体系、市场或流程，常用于科技或商业语境。
definitions.example_en: Smartphones are disrupting the traditional camera industry.
definitions.example_cn: 智能手机正在颠覆传统相机行业。

definitions.explanation_en: To break the continuity or harmony of a situation, especially by introducing unexpected or unwelcome elements.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过引入意外或不受欢迎的因素，打破某种情境的连续性或和谐状态。
definitions.example_en: His sudden outburst was disrupting the calm atmosphere of the meeting.
definitions.example_cn: 他突然的爆发打破了会议的平静氛围。

comparison.analysis: “Interrupt” (打断) 通常指短暂、非破坏性的中止，如打断讲话或流程，之后可恢复原状。而 “disrupting” 强调更深层、更持久的破坏，可能导致系统无法正常恢复。
“Disturb” (打扰) 多用于情绪、安宁或秩序层面的轻微干扰，如打扰睡眠或心情，程度较轻。而 “disrupting” 指的是结构性或功能性的严重混乱，影响更广泛、更严重。
“Derail” (使脱轨) 比喻性地指使计划、进程偏离轨道，常用于抽象目标（如项目、议程），强调偏离预定路径。而 “disrupting” 更强调对系统本身的冲击和破坏，不一定涉及路径偏离，而是功能失效。
